page.title: 11Transport
page.content: With the range of roads in the area, there is a wide variety of traffic, from{bicycles}and{cars}to{coaches}and long-distance{lorries,}not forgetting the farm{tractors}and other vehicles frequently spotted en route. As there are no shops in the area, with the exception of a P.O. at Weston and 2{mobile shops,}every family needs some form of personal transport, maybe {bicycles}for local use and cars for longer journeys and carrying luggage. A circular{bus service,}operated by National Travel, passes through the villages once a day on weekdays. There is no Sunday service. The main Eastern{rail}route, London to Scotland, runs almost parallel to the A1. There is an automatic barrier crossing on the line, in frequent use, with road access to Sutton by this route restricted to daylight hours.
